meanings.definition: A person who is very interested in or knowledgeable about a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The wonks in the science club love conducting experiments.
meanings.sent2: She became a wonks in history after reading many books on the subject.
meanings.sent3: The wonks at the library knew every book by heart.
meanings.sent4: He was a wonks in gardening, his knowledge blooming like a well-tended garden.
meanings.sent5: The wonks in astronomy could spot constellations even on cloudy nights.

meanings.definition: To study or work hard; to be absorbed in one's work or studies.
meanings.sent1: She wonks late into the night to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent2: They wonks diligently on their research project for weeks.
meanings.sent3: He wonks so much that he forgets to eat sometimes.
meanings.sent4: The artist wonks on his masterpiece, losing track of time.
meanings.sent5: The chef wonks in the kitchen, creating culinary masterpieces.
